dublin_core.dcvalue: Molecular dynamics MD simulations of immunoglobulin G IgG light chain dimer using particle mesh Ewald PME and cutoff methods of treating electrostatic interactions were performed The results indicate that structural parameters RMSD radius of gyration solvent accessible surface are very similar for both schemes however PME simulation shows increased mobility of side chains This leads to larger fluctuations in the distance between the monomers in the dimer molecule and as a consequence results in decreased number of interactions across the dimer interface The wall clock time of the simulations was also compared It was shown that the PME method is approximately 30 faster than the cutoff method for the system studied on a single processor
Analysis of the effect of electrostatic energy truncation in molecular dynamics simulations of immunoglobulin G light chain dimer.
